title.narrative: STRATEGY FOR QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2018, Quality of education is improved for all children, girls and boys, including those of the most disadvantaged, which contributes to Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, 100 per cent girls/boys of primary school and 70% girls/boys of 1st cycle of secondary school, particularly the most vulnerable, achieve quality and inclusive education, and 100% girls/boys and adolescents out of formal school benefit from alternative education.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, Quality of education is improved for all children, girls and boys, including those of the most disadvantaged

description.narrative: Teachers of formal basic education, in targeted primary schools, are trained and offer to 24867 students (5713 girls and 19154 boys) quality learning that improves their skills in both French and mathematics and the Elementary Primary Studies Certificate success rate. | Status:Met | As-of Date:04/02/2020
